content: waffle stitch scarf 5am the hookery free crochet pattern you will need 400g-500g of aran weight yarn yes really it s a yarn eater depending on how long you want your scarf to be 5 5mm crochet hook scissors stitch markers optional but recommended needle for weaving ends pattern notes this pattern is written in us & uk terms in this pattern we will use us double_crochet/uk treble crochet as well as us front post double_crochet/uk front post treble_crochet the chain 2 at the beginning of the row does count as a stitch you can swap the chain 2 at the beginning of the row for 2 stacked single crochets at the end of each row turn your work keep track of your first and last stitch by using stitch markerst finished scarf should measure approx 10 wide and 60 long 1 gauge gauge 14 stitches across and 4 row tall measure 4 x 4 using 5 5 mm us i- 9 hook take note of the right side vs the wrong side right side wrong side 2 foundation row chain 41 39 chain + 2 turning chains row 1 in the 4th chain from hook double_crochet in each chain made until the end turn your work 37 row 2 chain 2 counts as a stitch from here on fpdc in the next stitch *2dc fpdc in the next* repeat from *to* until the end of the row your last stitch should be a double_crochet turn 37 row 3 chain 2 double_crochet in the next stitch *fpdc in the next 2 stitches double_crochet in the next* repeat from *to* until the end of the row your last stitch should be a double crochet turn 37 3 repeat row 2 and 3 until you have a total of 115 row or you reach the length that you would like row 116 final row chain 2 double_crochet in each stitch across until end cut yarn and fasten_off weave in ends using a tapestry needle 4
